meanings.definition: Not complementary; not enhancing or completing each other
meanings.sent1: The colors of the painting were noncomplementary, making it look dull.
meanings.sent2: The shoes and the dress were noncomplementary, so she decided to change her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The noncomplementary flavors of the dish clashed in an unpleasant way.
meanings.sent4: Their noncomplementary personalities created constant tension in the office.
meanings.sent5: The noncomplementary music notes sounded like a jumble of discordant sounds.

meanings.definition: Not forming a pair or set with another element
meanings.sent1: The extra puzzle piece was noncomplementary and didn't fit anywhere.
meanings.sent2: The odd sock was noncomplementary to any of the pairs in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The noncomplementary chair stood out awkwardly among the matching set.
meanings.sent4: Her noncomplementary necklace was the only one that didn't belong in the collection.
meanings.sent5: The noncomplementary key refused to unlock any of the doors in the house.

meanings.sent1: The noncomplementary opinions led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: Their schedules were noncomplementary, making it hard to find time to meet.
meanings.sent3: The noncomplementary styles clashed in a fashion disaster.
meanings.sent4: The noncomplementary goals of the team caused confusion and inefficiency.
meanings.sent5: The noncomplementary scents in the room created a strange and unpleasant atmosphere.
